result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Deshawn Childs-Haywood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent. Cash bail applied.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment recommended.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre Deshawn Childs-Haywood

records.addlTxt: Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.

Plea and sentencing scheduled for 7-15-22 at 9:30 am is rescheduled to 9-22-22 at 2:30 pm. Court will be down on 7-15-22 because no court reporters are available. Parties agreed upon new court date via email.

Defendant Andre Deshawn Childs-Haywood in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Andre Deshawn Childs-Haywood in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Jacob Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andre Deshawn Childs-Haywood appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TLH.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Andre Deshawn Childs-Haywood in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 10 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/4/22 @ 1p

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:

Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/4/22 @ 1p
